properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Extensive fog can be expected at Cape Dorset today through much of the weekend as a large, slow-moving low pressure system gradually drifts towards the community. The fog may lift somewhat at times, especially when heavier bands of rain affect the community, but in general extended periods of zero to near zero visibility can be expected into the weekend. The fog may begin to dissipate Sunday afternoon depending on the location of the low pressure system. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-31T00:10:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T08:11:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3869011147.2019
Area: Cape Dorset
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain, heavy at times, will persist tonight as a trough of low pressure crosses New Brunswick and interacts with moisture from post tropical storm Erin. Total rainfall amounts of up to 70 mm are expected across portions of southern New Brunswick before the rain tapers off tonight or Friday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T12:59:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T03:00:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0441777910.2019
Area: Grand Lake and Queens County, Sussex - Kennebecasis Valley and Kings County, Saint John and County, Kent County, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Kouchibouguac National Park, Fundy National Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog has developed at Coral Harbour as a large, slow-moving low pressure system drifts near Southampton Island today. The fog may lift somewhat at times but is generally expected to continue today and tonight. Northerly winds will dissipate the fog Saturday morning when the low finally moves off towards Hudson Strait. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-31T00:24:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T08:25:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0339987299.2019
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A large low pressure system over Hudson Bay will continue to bring rain to Kimmirut this morning before tapering off to showers this afternoon and tonight. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T19:59:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T08:09:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3891214996.2019
Area: Kimmirut
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots. An area of strong thunderstorms over Lower Michigan is moving east-southeastward. These storms may reach Western Lake Erie after midnight. Wind gusts to 40 knots may be associated. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-30T15:10:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T00:12:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2541869930.2019
Area: Western Lake Erie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds are expected to strengthen this morning with gusts up to 110 km/h. These winds will diminish this afternoon as the winds shift to a southwesterly direction. ### Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-08-30T19:59:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T07:56:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2083858709.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain at times heavy will persist tonight as a trough of low pressure interacts with moisture from post tropical storm Erin. Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 70 mm are expected before the rain ends overnight tonight. In addition, waves near 4 metres will spread from west to east along the Atlantic Coast of Nova Scotia and will break higher along the beaches. Rip currents may also be an issue, and the public should exercise caution near the coast. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T12:59:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-30T00:58:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2236559220.2019
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strengthening northerly winds will affect Kivalliq tonight as a low pressure system continues to intensify in Hudson Bay. Winds will increase to 70 gusting 90 km/h tonight along most of the Hudson Bay coast and remain strong for much of Friday before gradually diminishing into Saturday. Other regions will see gusts near 80 km/h tonight through Friday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-30T11:38:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-29T19:39:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1394100008.2019
Area: Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove
